item.title: Euromonitor: Technology is increasingly influencing the growth of the toys and games industry
item.description: The worldwide toys and games market is expected to grow, driven by positive population trends in developing countries and a strong lineup of blockbuster movies. This combination is projected to result in a 4.5% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) until 2020. Euromonitor International, a global market research firm, revealed that global toy and game sales hit US$179.7 billion in 2015. In-game purchases and construction toys made up 30% of total sales, highlighting their significance within the industry.

item.title: Cisco has found that technology is influencing the way we work
item.description: The 2014 Cisco Connected World Technology Report (CCWTR) reveals that employers are adapting their policies to accommodate the growing desire for flexible work styles among Generation X (born 1960s-1980s) and Millennial (born 1980s-2000s) employees. This year’s CCWTR expands on its usual exploration of young workers’ mindsets and behaviors by examining how Gen X and HR professionals value connectivity, perceive their work availability, and influence IT policies, product design, and business competitiveness.

item.title: There is increasing interest in cold pressed juices
item.description: Source: Techsci Research. A TechSci Research report projects the global cold-pressed juice market to experience a significant growth rate, exceeding 10% annually, between 2016 and 2022. This anticipated growth is attributed to several factors, including increased disposable incomes, heightened consumer awareness, effective marketing campaigns by industry leaders, widespread product availability, and a strong global distribution network. Global GDP per capita, adjusted for purchasing power parity, rose from US$14,020.31 in 2012 to US$15,470.

item.title: Organic cosmetics are becoming increasingly popular
item.description: A new report from TechSci Research, titled Global Organic Cosmetics Market By Product Type, By Point of Sale, By Region, Competition Forecast and Opportunities, 2011 - 2021, reveals that the global organic cosmetics market is expected to experience significant growth through 2021. This growth is driven by rising health concerns and a growing awareness of the negative effects of conventional cosmetic chemicals, coupled with the benefits offered by organic alternatives.

item.title: The benefits of pomelo for your health
item.description: Source: Chulalongkorn University website. Research by Dr. Sirichai Adisakwattana, an Associate Professor at Chulalongkorn University in Thailand, suggests that concentrated extracts from pomelo fruit possess antioxidant properties, which contribute to overall health, and can reduce fat levels. To reach these findings, Dr. Adisakwattana created powdered concentrates from six varieties of pomelo. His analysis showed that these concentrates could lower both cholesterol and blood lipid levels. However, due to the fruit’s natural sugar content, the university recommends limiting consumption to a small portion each day.

item.title: Southeast Asia is leading the way in digital transformation and digital leadership
item.description: Source: SAP. Agree or disagree? Management and staff in Southeast Asia and globally share their thoughts in the Leaders 2020 study. Almost 25% of Southeast Asian companies are considered digital leaders, according to a recent study by SAP and Oxford Economics. This figure surpasses the global average of 16% reported in the Leaders 2020 study. This new category of high-achieving companies reports greater profit increases, improved employee engagement, and more inclusive workplace environments.

item.title: Mergers and acquisitions in the early stages are decelerating in Southeast Asia and Korea
item.description: Announcements for early-stage mergers and acquisitions (M&A) in Q4 2016 are predicted to be similar to the same period last year. This is attributed to reduced early-stage M&A activity in Southeast Asia and South Korea, as per the latest Intralinks Deal Flow Predictor (DFP) report released by Intralinks Holdings. Intralinks provides software and services, including virtual data rooms (VDRs), for managing M&A transactions. Southeast Asia, encompassing Singapore, Malaysia, and Indonesia, is experiencing a significant 47.

item.title: Smaato has analyzed the effectiveness of mobile video ads in the first quarter of 2016
item.description: Source: Smaato website. Smaato, a global platform connecting mobile publishers and app developers with advertisers in real-time, has published its Q1 2016 Global Trends in Mobile Advertising report. The report leverages Smaato’s analysis of billions of mobile ad impressions that ran on its exchange platform in the first quarter of 2016. The findings highlight significant growth in mobile video advertising, which generated 11 times higher effective cost per thousand impressions (eCPMs) for publishers than other ad formats.

item.title: Australia has a high usage of digital payment methods
item.description: A recent Mastercard study shows Australians are steadily adopting digital payment methods, with over 80% using contactless payments weekly. In fact, a significant number of Australians get frustrated when stores don’t offer contactless payment options, and some even choose to shop elsewhere in such situations. Supermarkets, retail stores, and gas stations are where Australians most frequently use contactless cards. Garry Duursma, Mastercard Australia and New Zealand’s Head of Market Development and Payment Innovation, points out that Australians find contactless payments convenient and efficient.

item.title: Small and medium-sized businesses in Singapore are increasingly transitioning to cloud services
item.description: Parallels, a company specializing in hosting and cloud services, has released an updated report on the Singaporean cloud market for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), called Parallels SMB Cloud Insights. This 2014 report predicts significant growth for the SMB cloud services market in Singapore, projecting it to reach S$916 million by 2017. This represents a strong three-year compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 21%. Source: Parallels. Zanni. John Zanni, Chief Marketing Officer for Service Providers at Parallels, observed that the Asia Pacific region is poised to outpace the rest of the world in cloud adoption due to its later start.

item.title: TechSci Research believes that the organic dairy market has significant potential
item.description: A recent report by TechSci Research, a global management consulting firm, predicts significant growth in the global organic dairy products market. Driven by factors like increased health consciousness, a growing urban population, and rising spending on organic foods, the market is expected to achieve a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of over 11% between 2016 and 2021. The report, titled Global Organic Dairy Products Market By Product Type, By Region, Competition Forecast and Opportunities, 2011 - 2021, identifies expanding product lines, readily available organic dairy products, strong distribution networks, increasing internet access, and proactive marketing strategies from key players as contributing factors to this projected growth.

item.title: Technavio provides an overview of the e-retail market for fashion in India
item.description: Men’s clothing currently holds the largest portion of India’s online fashion retail market. Major companies in this market include Amazon, Flipkart, Snapdeal, Jabong, and Yepme. Analysts at Technavio anticipate substantial growth in India’s online fashion retail sector, projecting a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of nearly 17% from 2016 to 2020. This surge is attributed to the convenience and affordability of online shopping, with diverse payment choices and a wider selection of products readily available.

item.title: Increase your productivity by installing a treadmill at your desk
item.description: A recent study featured in the journal Plos One found that using a treadmill desk could lead to higher productivity compared to a traditional desk setup. [Image of a treadmill desk] Source: Plos One This study, titled “Treadmill Workstations: The Effects of Walking while Working on Physical Activity and Work Performance”, was conducted by researchers from the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities, University of Texas-Arlington, Mayo Clinic, and Arizona State University. Over 12 months, they observed the impact of treadmill desks on physical activity and work output at a financial services company.

item.title: In Asia, cards account for 52% of payments, but there are new emerging payment tools
item.description: A study by ACI Worldwide and Ovum, “2017 Global Payments Insight Survey: Merchants and Retailers,” found that 79% of merchants and retailers believe a comprehensive approach to payments across different channels is crucial for a positive customer experience. The study showed that while the EMV chip card standard has reduced in-person fraud, online fraud is on the rise. Merchants and retailers are planning to significantly increase their investments in payments to improve customer experience (a 50% increase compared to 2015).

item.title: The IDA in Singapore has compiled a report on home computer usage in Singapore for the year 2014
item.description: A 2014 survey by the Infocomm Development Authority (IDA) of Singapore revealed a surge in smartphone, computer, and internet use among Singaporean seniors. The study, titled Annual Survey on Infocomm Usage in Households, found that 74% of Singaporean residents used a computer in the three months leading up to the survey. Senior citizens aged 50 and above showed the most significant increase in computer usage. Between 2012 and 2014, computer use among seniors aged 50 to 59 grew by 14 percentage points, while those over 60 showed an 11 percentage-point increase.

item.title: Companies that experience data breaches in the Asia Pacific region are unlikely to be forgiven
item.description: New research from SafeNet reveals that data breaches significantly influence customer trust. The global study, including participants from Japan and Australia, found that 65% wouldn’t patronize a business that experienced a financial data breach, compromising credit card details, bank accounts, or login credentials. SafeNet’s Q2 Breach Level Index reported 237 data breaches from April to June 2014, exposing over 175 million records globally. These findings highlight the impact of data breaches on customer loyalty and revenue.

item.title: SUVs are driving the sales of cars, according to Euromonitor
item.description: According to Euromonitor International, a global market research firm, worldwide light vehicle sales increased by 1.7% from 2014 to 2015. This growth was primarily fueled by the rising popularity of sports utility vehicles (SUVs), which saw a 22% surge in sales since 2015. In 2015, SUVs became the leading automotive segment globally, surpassing lower medium cars and representing 22.9% of all light vehicle sales. SUV sales have significantly increased from 5 million units in 2000 to 20 million in 2015, with projections indicating a further rise to 42 million units by 2031.

item.title: IDC Financial Insights selects the top 50 mobile innovators in the Asia-Pacific region
item.description: At the start of 2014, IDC Financial Insights released a report titled “Mobilizing Financial Services in Asia/Pacific,” which highlighted the most innovative mobile initiatives in the financial services sector. They recently shared an infographic summarizing their findings. The report identifies Australia, mainland China, Hong Kong, India, South Korea, and Singapore as frontrunners in mobile adoption within the Asia Pacific region (excluding Japan). IDC Financial Insights emphasizes a significant opportunity for mobile commerce growth, fueled by increasing mobile device usage in Asia and a strong consumer interest in mobile payments.

item.title: The premium image of cheese is advantageous in Indonesia
item.description: Indonesian families, especially those residing in major urban areas, are anticipated to increasingly incorporate cheese as a staple ingredient in their meals. This trend is linked to a growing consumer preference for preparing Western dishes, such as pizzas, pastas, cakes, pastries, and toast, which often feature cheese, within their own homes, as indicated by research conducted by Euromonitor. A notable shift in preference is the rising popularity of cheese paired with white bread, replacing traditional spreads like chocolate sprinkles, jam, or honey.

item.title: The implementation of smart technologies is increasing revenues by up to 33%
item.description: A global Avanade study, involving Australian executives, business unit leaders, and IT decision-makers, reveals that a majority of business leaders are already investing in and seeing positive results from incorporating smart technologies in their workplaces. A key motivator is the potential for increased revenue, with business and IT leaders projecting up to a 33% revenue boost from these technologies within the next five years. Furthermore, companies anticipate retraining existing employees, generating new roles, and restructuring their organizations as they predict the repurposing of up to 20% of current roles.

item.title: The Compass Index indicates a positive business outlook in the Asia-Pacific region
item.description: Despite a global economic downturn, the Compass Index shows optimism in the Asia Pacific (APAC) business sector, with Australian businesses reporting the highest confidence levels. However, the Index emphasizes that maintaining growth requires agility and innovation in business practices. Source: Compass Index infographic. Australia is particular optimistic on business growth. Compass Offices, a provider of Asian serviced offices, virtual offices, and meeting rooms, surveyed their global clientele for the Compass Index.

item.title: Monitoring worldwide travel patterns with Euromonitor
item.description: Source: Euromonitor website. Euromonitor International, a market research provider, has published its annual World Travel Market Global Trends Report. This 2014 edition, like the previous nine, identifies emerging patterns in the travel industry. For the Asia Pacific and Middle East regions, the report highlights these key trends: The Middle East is using design tourism to reshape its image. By integrating design into tourist attractions and experiences, the region hopes to attract more visitors and creative professionals.

item.title: Ericsson predicts that the Internet of Things will surpass mobile phones by 2018
item.description: According to the most recent Ericsson Mobility Report*, the Internet of Things (IoT) is poised to become the biggest category of connected devices, surpassing mobile phones by 2018. The number of IoT connected devices is projected to rise by 23% annually from 2015 to 2021, with cellular IoT predicted to experience the fastest growth. By 2021, nearly 16 billion of the anticipated 28 billion connected devices will be IoT devices.

item.title: HubSpot uncovers the true desires of buyers when it comes to salespeople
item.description: HubSpot’s recent report, Asia Pacific Buyers Have Spoken: Sales Needs to Evolve, reveals what Asia Pacific buyers desire in a sales experience, from initial call topics to the best time for sales interactions. The report suggests that sales isn’t necessarily becoming more challenging, but rather traditional sales strategies are losing their effectiveness. The mismatch between current sales tactics and buyer expectations is the root of the problem. HubSpot asserts that conversions will increase if salespeople align their approach with buyer preferences.

item.title: In the new application economy, leaders can quickly fall behind and become laggards
item.description: Lim May-Ann, Managing Director of TRPC, presented the findings of the 2016 CA Technologies Asia Pacific & Japan Application Economy Index. Singapore currently holds the top spot in the Asia Pacific and Japan region regarding the application economy. However, it faces a potential decline to fourth place in future potential, according to the inaugural Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) Application Economy Index (AEI) 2016. This index assesses the readiness of 10 APJ markets to thrive in the digital age.

item.title: Singapore ranked among the top five in the 2016 WE Cities Index
item.description: Dell has identified the top 25 cities worldwide that cultivate high-potential women entrepreneurs (HPWE) for 2016 through their Women Entrepreneur Cities Index (WE Cities). This unique index assesses a city’s capacity to attract and promote the growth of women-led businesses. The study focused on cities rather than countries to highlight how local policies and initiatives impact women entrepreneurs, in addition to national legislation and norms. The WE Cities findings will serve as a starting point for discussions at the seventh annual Dell Women’s Entrepreneur Network Summit (DWEN).

item.title: The Dubai consumer electronics market is projected to exceed a value of US$3 billion by the year 2020
item.description: A Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry (DCCI) analysis, presented at GITEX Technology Week 2016, projects that the Dubai consumer electronics market will expand by 4.7% over the next four years, surpassing US$3 billion by 2020. The analysis emphasizes Dubai’s robust retail sales growth despite challenges from low oil prices and global economic uncertainties. This strength is credited to strong underlying factors, including a growing population, increasing incomes, and a consistent influx of tourists.

item.title: There is a growing trend of adults purchasing toys and games
item.description: In 2016, games and puzzles experienced an 8% surge in the global market, surpassing construction toys as the fastest-growing toy category, according to Euromonitor International, a global market research firm. This impressive growth also marks the highest for the category since 2002. Although construction toys saw a growth of 7.8% in 2016, a dip compared to the double-digit growth of 2015, they still dominated the traditional toys and games market with a value of US$10 billion.

item.title: Euromonitor reports that skincare is a popular trend
item.description: Euromonitor International has reported that the global beauty industry is experiencing growth, particularly in emerging markets, as consumers increasingly adopt more comprehensive beauty routines and upgrade to premium products. Skincare stands out as the dominant segment in most markets, with global sales projected to exceed US$130 billion by 2019. “Consumers are allocating a significant portion of their beauty spending on skincare, averaging US$15 per person annually,” notes Irina Barbalova, Head of Beauty and Personal Care at Euromonitor International.

item.title: Consuming a balanced amount of protein helps dieters maintain muscle mass at a slower rate
item.description: Source: Nestlé. Nestlé Research Center collaborated with global scientists and found that consistent protein intake throughout the day might reduce muscle loss during weight loss attempts. Published in the American Journal of Physiology - Endocrinology and Metabolism, the study explored ways to promote weight loss in obese older men while preventing muscle loss. Muscle loss can hinder weight loss, decrease strength and functional capacity, and heighten the risk of disability and mortality.

item.title: A recent study by Criteo reveals changing shopping habits in Singapore
item.description: · Singaporean shoppers use multiple devices throughout their purchasing journey. · Physical stores must adapt to the local trend of “showrooming” and invest in integrating their online and offline channels. · Enhancing last-mile delivery will help local retailers compete more effectively with international e-commerce businesses. Criteo, a performance marketing technology company, has discovered that shopping habits are evolving among consumers in Singapore. Research by Edelman Intelligence found that Singaporeans now possess or have access to an average of 4.

item.title: A worldwide survey reveals that workers do not have the necessary resources to concentrate on their tasks
item.description: Plantronics recently released the findings of a global study conducted by Oxford Economics, which focused on the impact of open workspaces on employees. The study aimed to understand employee preferences regarding work environments and provide insights for managers to maximize productivity and satisfaction among their teams. Oxford Economics gathered data from over 1,200 senior executives and non-managerial employees across various industries and job functions. Participants represented a global spectrum, including the US, Canada, the UK, Germany, India, China, Australia, Denmark, Sweden, Finland, and Norway.

item.title: Childcare centers are emerging in Chinese workplaces
item.description: Government policy changes are fueling the growth of the preschool or childcare market in China. Technavio forecasts a CAGR exceeding 6% for this market between 2016 and 2020. This growth is largely attributed to recent policy adjustments, notably the 2015 amendment to the one-child policy, now permitting couples to have two children. This shift aims to balance population development and, coupled with rising disposable incomes among middle-class families, is driving increased preschool enrollment.

item.title: Vitamin D does not increase longevity
item.description: While some believe vitamin D is a miracle cure, new research from the University of Cambridge, which analyzed data from almost 100 studies, indicates that vitamin D supplementation alone doesn’t decrease mortality rates in older adults. Past research connected low vitamin D levels with illnesses like multiple sclerosis, cancer, and cardiovascular disease. To clarify if vitamin D supplementation by itself (without calcium or other interventions) impacts death from various causes, researchers examined 73 observational cohort studies and 22 randomized trials on naturally occurring vitamin D and supplements (D2 or D3).

item.title: In the corporate hierarchy, creative roles are gaining prominence
item.description: The increasing prominence of design-led thinking in business and strategic problem-solving is benefiting creatives’ careers globally. A 2016 Adobe survey of over 1,700 creatives, including graphic and web designers and artists, revealed that these professionals feel they are making a bigger impact within their organizations. Over half of respondents in the Asia Pacific region (56%) reported a greater impact compared to two years prior, with 89% stating that their companies now place more emphasis on creativity and design thinking.

item.title: Bangkok is the top tourist destination in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: Source: Mastercard. Report cover. Although Bangkok, Thailand remains the top spot for visitors in the Asia Pacific, the latest Mastercard Asia Pacific Destinations Index 2017* shows that Singapore outpaces the Thai capital in total tourist spending. Singapore experienced an 18% increase in visitor spending between 2015 and 2016. As one of just five destinations in the top 20 for overall expenditure to hit a minimum daily spend of US$200, Singapore drew in the biggest spenders at US$254 per day.

item.title: Accenture states that just-in-time marketing leads to higher conversion rates
item.description: Source: Accenture infographic. A recent report from Accenture, based on a survey of over 500 chief marketing officers (CMOs) globally, suggests that just-in-time marketing can lead to a greater return on investment and significantly boost revenue growth. Companies using this method are three times more likely to surpass their competitors in terms of revenue growth. Just-in-time marketing focuses on crafting relevant marketing content precisely when needed and tailoring it to appeal to interested consumers at the exact moment they are ready to make a purchase.

item.title: CSIRO is expediting promising research through ON Accelerate3
item.description: The Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO) has chosen 10 teams for ON Accelerate3, a nationwide program supporting research projects in Australia. This program began in 2015 to enhance innovation by connecting different fields, industries, science, and business. These teams, representing various institutions like Flinders University and CSIRO, are tackling challenges in areas such as food security and healthcare. CSIRO Chief Executive Dr. Larry Marshall emphasized the diversity of this group, their potential to create new jobs, and their ability to address significant societal issues.

item.title: The desired features in chatbots according to Amdocs
item.description: A recent study focusing on artificial intelligence (AI) spending in major communications and media companies across the Americas, Europe, and Asia reveals that the anticipated increase in AI-powered customer service might be hindered by misguided investments and a shortage of skilled personnel. This research, commissioned by Amdocs and conducted by Forrester Consulting, surveyed over 2,500 individuals, including CEOs, senior decision-makers, and consumers. The study found that in Asia, nearly one-third of consumers interact with virtual agents weekly.

item.title: A white paper providing solutions for talent management in the Chinese hospitality industry
item.description: Florida International University’s Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management (CSHTM) and its Institute for Hospitality & Tourism Education & Research (IHTER) have published a new resource for HR professionals and hospitality businesses, particularly those working with Chinese markets. The white paper, titled “Managing Growing Pains of China’s Relentless Hotel Development Pipeline,” examines the significant lack of qualified talent within China’s rapidly expanding hotel industry. The paper offers practical solutions such as professional development programs, conflict resolution strategies, and clearly defined career paths to attract and retain skilled employees.

item.title: Pre-registered delegates can access a report on industry innovations through Food&HotelAsia
item.description: To commemorate its 40th anniversary, Food&HotelAsia (FHA) has partnered with Euromonitor International to release a new white paper. Titled “Smart Innovations Transforming the Food and Hospitality Landscape by 2020,” the 20-page report examines significant disruptions influencing the industry. Based on research conducted by UBM and Euromonitor, the white paper incorporates insights from a survey of over 1,000 suppliers and manufacturers across key food, hotel, and food service equipment sectors in Asia.

item.title: Improving heart health with cranberry juice
item.description: Drinking cranberry juice every day could potentially lead to healthier blood sugar and cholesterol levels, according to recent research. In a study involving overweight but otherwise healthy participants, those who drank two glasses (450ml) of a cranberry-based beverage daily for two weeks showed improvements in blood sugar stability, reducing spikes and dips often associated with cravings and fatigue. These benefits continued when the two-glass intake was maintained. After eight weeks of daily consumption, the same cranberry beverage was also linked to higher levels of “good” HDL cholesterol, known for promoting artery health by removing “bad” cholesterol.

item.title: Kaspersky provides solutions to combat ransomware
item.description: Ransomware is increasingly targeting businesses, encrypting files and demanding payment for decryption keys. A Kaspersky Lab report reveals a six-fold increase in ransomware attacks against businesses from 2015 to 2016, affecting one in ten business users. Cybercriminals are focusing on businesses, particularly small and medium-sized companies. A Kaspersky Lab and B2B International study found that 42% of respondents from these businesses considered ransomware a major threat. Even brief data unavailability can severely impact small businesses, potentially halting operations entirely.

item.title: Adjusting the workforce culture to the current reality
item.description: Source: Microsoft. Digital transformation requires change both externally and internally. A recent study by Microsoft highlights the need for Singaporean organizations to adopt a new work culture to successfully navigate digital transformation. The research reveals that a significant 77% of surveyed employees believe their organizations could invest further in cultural development.
